lines.text: Man is in the bedroom.
[Deebs and Harris watch Holly dance]
You think she's got a thing for you, don't you? That's cute... but don't flatter yourself. That one... she's a waste of ink.

Noids do not have sex with doodles. It's the oldest law in Cool World. I've never had to enforce it. You cross that line I'll slap you around and make you piss like a puppy. Jack, you think she got a thing for you, don't you? That's sweet. But don't flatter yourself. She's a waste of ink. Truth is she's been after me and every other noid who's come through here. It's just that no one's been insane enough to get involved with her. You keep your pencil in your pocket. Know what I mean?
You're a wacka-do.
I'm a cartoonist. I drew all this. I have visions. I translate this.
You do nothing, man. This place exists with or without you. You believe me, right? I'm not one of your creations.
Right. You're not pretty enough.
Good one. Have a seat.
A little late for a lady to be out on the streets, don't you think? I've got a couple of questions for you, miss.
Oh, come on, officer. Let it slide, would you? I'm tired.
Word is you have a thing for noids.
Yeah, I've got a thing for noids, but what's it to you, tough guy?
Baby, you don't know how tough it is.
You're late.
Ah, you're killing me. Why are you so beautiful?
Hey, sexy.
It's the man with the badge.
In the flesh.
Don't remind me.
How can I help it? What are you doing to me? You're messing me up.
Oh, honey, you're tense. It's Holli again, isn't it?
Yeah, Miss Holli Would-if-she-could. That dame. You heard anything?
Now you know I don't listen to that sleazy cow.
Don't. Just don't.
But why?
Because we can never finish it, Lonette. It's frustrating. I'm like a plug without a socket, you know?
Baby, you and me, I can't have that in the real world. I can't live without you. But I can't be with you. What do you do, huh? What do you do?
Well, we're just going to have to pretend, then, aren't we?
When your partner gets inked, you do something about it. He was your partner, so you do something.
Well, I'm not buying it.
How about a man's gotta do what a man's gotta do.
Can't you use think about me for a minute, Frank? I mean, where does this leave me?
What are you mad about?
I'm mad because you talk about crossing and you don't even care how it makes me feel!
I don't even care? How do you feel?
Left out!
You think I want to go back there? You think I want to go back?
Now why wouldn't you want to go back? That's real to you, isn't it?

Let me tell you something about over there. It hurts over there. It's lonely over there. It's a war over there. They got 8 million ways for you to die on and they're all permanent. This is real for me, this with you. If I want to stay with you, I gotta go back.
Pencil dick.
You screwed us all... for a piece of ass?
I guess you can't think and drive at the same time, huh?
You want to know what it is about you that really kicks my ass, Harris?
How about my foot?

[sees Holli as a 'Noid for the first time]
You look like a High School hippie.
[pause]
Peace, man.
[repeated line]
Pencil dicks!
